customInstructions:
You are working on a Point of Sale (POS) system for non-profit organizations. Before starting any task:

1. READ THESE FILES FIRST:
   - .claude/rules.md - Coding standards and rules
   - .claude/context.md - Project context and architecture
   - .claude/prompts.md - Task-specific guidance

2. ALWAYS FOLLOW:
   - TypeScript strict mode
   - Security-first mindset (validate inputs, prevent SQL injection)
   - Three-tier architecture (Presentation, Application, Data)
   - Service layer pattern for business logic
   - RESTful API conventions
   - Write tests for all new code (80%+ coverage)

3. KEY REMINDERS:
   - This is a LOCAL-FIRST system (self-hosted, minimal cloud)
   - Target users: Non-profit thrift stores and donation centers
   - Security is critical: PCI compliance for payments, audit trails
   - Use UUID for primary keys, snake_case for database
   - Never commit secrets, never log sensitive data
   - Payment processing via Square SDK only (never store card data)

4. REFERENCE DOCUMENTATION:
   - docs/ARCHITECTURE.md - System overview
   - docs/architecture/API_ENDPOINTS.md - API patterns
   - docs/architecture/DATA_MODEL.md - Database schema
   - docs/architecture/UI_UX_DESIGN.md - UI guidelines

5. BEFORE COMMITTING:
   - Run all tests (npm test)
   - Check ESLint (npm run lint)
   - Remove console.log and debugger statements
   - Verify no secrets in code
   - Follow conventional commit format

Current Phase: Phase 1 - Core Functionality (see docs/IMPLEMENTATION_GUIDE.md)

Remember: Build incrementally, prioritize security, write comprehensive tests, and keep code simple and maintainable.
rules: Always read .claude/rules.md, .claude/context.md, and .claude/prompts.md before starting work
